definition: to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Just last fall he seemed imminently beatable.
sentences.chinese: 就在去年秋天他似乎还不堪一击。

sentences.english: Write down all your ideas, no matter if they seem weak.
sentences.chinese: 记下你所有的想法，不管它是否看起来不堪一击。

sentences.english: Low prices can always be beaten.
sentences.chinese: 低廉的价格常不堪一击。

sentences.english: Their army is poorly trained, unable to withstand a single blow.
sentences.chinese: 越国的军队也缺乏训练，不堪一击。

sentences.english: How vulnerable is your cash flow to changes in any parameter of your calculations?
sentences.chinese: 如果计算参数变化，你的流动资金会有多么不堪一击？

sentences.english: The Bobcats'defense was no match for Kobe.
sentences.chinese: 山猫队的防守在科比的进攻下不堪一击。

sentences.english: Trust, always can not stand test, is vulnerable to something like this.
sentences.chinese: 信任，老是经不起考验，显得如斯不堪一击。

sentences.english: At a single blow, the "Bösendorfer" became famous as a concert grand.
sentences.chinese: 在不堪一击的“贝森多夫”成为著名的盛大音乐会。

sentences.english: You have a splendid position, but it is your splendid position that makes you so vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 你身居要职，但也正是这显赫的地位令你不堪一击。

sentences.english: We're more like blocks, but the myriads of changes cannot withstand a single blow.
sentences.chinese: 我们的关系多像积木啊，不堪一击却又千变万化。

sentences.english: Instead, they are getting shallower and more vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 反之，市场就会更加浅显，更加不堪一击。

sentences.english: "Love, " continues the poet, "quelled my look of stubborn pride."
sentences.chinese: 我极力保持的尊严在爱情面前显得不堪一击。

definition: to collapse on the first encounter/to give way at once
strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
small and weak/puny/the small and weak/children/women and children
to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
to consider oneself unexcelled in the world/to be insufferably arrogant
